Until now, many girls of such families rebelled against such forced marriages and married the person of their choice after attaining 18 years with the help of legal support. But now, they have to wait till attaining 21 years. This will be misused by patriarchal families to threaten and control them.

Conclusion: Hindi should be the national language of India
Premise: English is an international language and is spoken by most of Indians. So, if Hindi is made the national language, people who cannot speak Hindi will be at disadvantage in many things such as getting government jobs, understanding circulars, etc.

Conclusion: We should invest in sustainable alternative fuels for aviation
Premise: These fuels currently cost 2 to 5 times more than kerosene. Facilitating and multiplying its production will automatically reduce its cost.

Conclusion: We should stop subsidies for fossil fuels and expand the EU Emissions Trading System (ETS)
Premise: Currently the ETS only applies to certain carbon-emitting industries covering 40% of the EU's greenhouse gas emissions. To effectively combat climate change 40% is not enough. That is why the ETS has to be expanded to at least cover agriculture and transport as well.  In Addition to the extension of the ETS the subsidies in fossil fuels (coal, oil and gas) must be cut in the near future.

Conclusion: We should promote the use of nuclear energy
Premise: Worldwide, nuclear power has prevented emissions of 240 billion tonnes of CO2 and prevented 1.8 million lives due to prevented air pollution (Kharecha, Hansen 2013).

Conclusion: We should protect bird habitats in built environments
Premise: Glass is one of the biggest causes of human death for birds.

Conclusion: We should promote the use of nuclear energy
Premise: Nuclear energy is not safe and it is not green because of radioactive waste. We have some conditions for sustainable green energy (at least solar, wind, biomethane etc.).

Conclusion: We should promote a culture of exchange and sharing of goods and services
Premise: All this lengthens the life cycle of a product and reduces waste.

Conclusion: We should limit the use of fireworks
Premise: I have also seen ex-soldiers shaking after someone sets off loud fireworks. Yes they should be banned.  Abhorrent things.

Conclusion: We should teach Esperanto, a common and neutral language, at all European schools
Premise: Makes sense to me, its easy to learn and doesn't come with any nationalist baggage.

Conclusion: We should improve migration policies
Premise: No more immigration! It has already come at too large of a cost. The EU must provide channels for the European people to democratically vote for the mass deportation of migrants.

Conclusion: We should increase the EU budget by including more direct contributions
Premise: The money from this could be allocated to pan-European projects, new citizen services, etc, tangible and prestigious results that may prompt others to join in.

Conclusion: We should preserve European culture
Premise: Europe’s rapid Islamisation must be stopped. It is, therefore, necessary to stop the illegal migration of African and Asian people who do not fit with European culture.

Conclusion: We should prohibit certain energy-intensive cryptocurrencies
Premise: According to BBC: 'Bitcoin uses more electricity annually than the whole of Argentina'

Conclusion: We should improve and modernize our energy infrastructure
Premise: A green initiative that I can endorse whole-heartedly. Rational environmentalism can save both our planet and our democracy (from the menace of the radical Greens).

Conclusion: We should impose an IQ test to immigrants
Premise: This is a huge discrimination.  Everyone should have the chance to develop to a personal level. Or should we all do an IQ-test to stay in our country? Because it could avoid dangerous things like rasicm.

Conclusion: We should stop mass migration.
Premise: Organizing, promoting, directing and financing mass migration is a crime against humanity.

Conclusion: We should restrict immigration.
Premise: Foreigners and immigrants must not be provided the same services and advantages as native people.

Conclusion: We should not have any immigration from non-European or non-first-world countries
Premise: Halting all immigration to EU from non-European or non-first-world countries will lead to an even more competitive advantage for the USA and other countries as our population is shrinking rapidly.

Conclusion: We should support Frontex.
Premise: Frontex is a key agency and is called to play a crucial role in the coming years. Yet, it lacks the necessary political support it deserves to carry out its mission.

Conclusion: We should stop immigration.
Premise: The organization of mass migration is a heinous crime. No more immigration from non-European or non-first-world countries.

Conclusion: We should stop making one-cent coins
Premise: A one-cent coin costs about 60% more to produce than it is actually worth.

Conclusion: We should stop daylight saving time change
Premise: If the European Council listened to the results of the inquiry made by the European Commission. 'The EU was set to stop changing its clocks in 2021, but then came Brexit, the pandemic, and some messy international bureaucracy'.

Conclusion: We should put the accent on traditional values and on preserving family life
Premise: The family is people's foundation and it rests on it all their lives and work, and this needs to be valued.

Conclusion: We should protect the European border
Premise: Only together and with  Frontex we ensure the management of EU borders. Migrants from Africa and Asia will arrive in increasing numbers in the coming years.

Conclusion: We should not have any immigration from non-European or non first-world countries
Premise: Saying no to any migration is just stupid and irrealistic.

Conclusion: We should remove unauthorized asylum seekers or migrants.
Premise: Unauthorized asylum seekers or migrants have no right to be in the country where they are unauthorized.

Conclusion: We should strengthen Frontex and control immigration
Premise: Bigger financial resources for Frontex and military action in Syria will stop the conflict.

Conclusion: We should not have illegal immigrants!
Premise: We can only employ people in understaffed job fields.

Conclusion: We should strengthen Frontex and control immigration.
Premise: Frontex must be given powers and resources to shut down the migratory routes entirely.

Conclusion: We should strengthen our ties with Ukraine and prepare for its membership in the EU
Premise: We must support countries that want to improve the welfare and rights of their citizens. If a country wants to join the EU and meets the conditions for joining, the decision to join is solely between the candidate country and the EU.

Conclusion: We should give up developing electric vehicles
Premise: Electric cars are much cheaper to use than fuel cars over the life cycle of a car.

Conclusion: We should ban the trading of virtual currencies.
Premise: Cracking down on virtual currencies is not only to ensure the smooth advancement of carbon peak and carbon neutrality, but also to protect the country's financial order.

Conclusion: We should ban the trading of virtual currencies.
Premise: Cryptocurrency can change the way of value transmission, that is, it can allow the uncontrolled flow of funds around the world.

Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.
Premise: Most people have to rely on centralized information distribution and dissemination platforms to publish information. It is easy to control the output and control of ideology, social ideas and hotspots.

Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.
Premise: You can barely recover privacy. It's hard to imagine what companies do with personal information, including who they actually sell it to.

Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.
Premise: Recording precise data of individuals can improve individual lives; recording huge data of groups can optimize resource allocation.

Conclusion: We should restrict minors from playing online games.
Premise: Many teenagers in China use electronic devices to play games as the only entertainment after study. At the same time, the same kind of people in Europe and the United States choose more diverse ways.

Conclusion: We should restrict minors from playing online games.
Premise: Ban them from playing games and they may indulge in short videos on Douyin.

Conclusion: We should restrict minors from playing online games.
Premise: Students who do not learn well are more likely to indulge in games. They cannot find a sense of accomplishment in real life.

Conclusion: We should open up three-child policy to encourage childbirth.
Premise: Other measures such as subsidizing childbirth, reducing the cost of health care and education for the population, and protecting women more from the law and the workplace are more imminent.

Conclusion: We should open up three-child policy to encourage childbirth.
Premise: No matter what the social policy is, the more the society develops, the more free people are, and the more independent women are. The decline in fertility is an inevitable trend.

Conclusion: We should prohibit capital monopoly.
Premise: Capital monopolies distort market prices and undermine fair competition in the market.

Conclusion: We should prevent the disorderly expansion of capital.
Premise: The means by which the giants seized the market was essentially by selling below cost, which is unfair competition, and then using their monopoly position to raise prices, which is divorced from the intent of a market economy.

Conclusion: We should vigorously develop the countryside.
Premise: Unemployment and urbanization when combined are slums and instability, so the rural areas need to be allowed to absorb the unemployed.

Conclusion: Carbon emissions trading should be limited.
Premise: Climate change is a global issue facing mankind, and with carbon dioxide emissions from all countries, greenhouse gases are surging, posing a threat to life systems.

Conclusion: Carbon emissions trading should be limited.
Premise: No one can stop global warming, which is inherently part of the Earth's geological cycle. That's why topics such as reducing CO2 emissions are a false proposition.
